comments:
I created a very long version number 
(v12345678901234567890123456789012345678901234567890), and now when I try to 
version or access revision history for the module, I get the following internal 
error.

I realize that eclipse may want to limit the size of the version string, but 
eclipse allowed me to enter in this as a valid version number, and now gives me 
errors when trying to access it.

Also, is there any way to "clean up the CVSROOT/history and CVSROOT/val-tags 
that eclipse creates in CVS?  I don't want to mess up eclipse, and I don't know 
what is the "proper" method for doing this.


---

1. Re. the long version number, I understand this bug but it will not be 
fixed, as it is in the old (1.0) codebase and we are busy preparing the new 
codebase for release. This bug does not appear in the new codebase. Good catch 
though, thanks for the report!

2. Eclipse doesn't rely on the server having a history of any kind. If you 
turn off history logging on the server, the contents of these files will no 
longer be important. In this case, the only difference you may see in Eclipse 
is that it may not know what Versions exist for a given project; you can 
always 'auto-define' the tags from a resource in the repositories view. See 
your CVS server man pages for more info on these files and how to get rid of 
them.
